author: Sam Warner
title: Strictly: Twitter gets confused over sausages and Bruno's bollocks - Strictly Come Dancing Reality TV
text: Another week of Strictly Come Dancing, and with it another round of glitz, cringe and some genuinely great performances. Digital Spy was watching along and rounded up the best Twitter reactions of the night (yes, including THAT Bruno incident). © BBC / Ray Burmiston/Matt BurlemStrictly Come Dancing 2015 judges There was a lot of confusion over sausages:#strictly 'Giovanni has been throwing me around, I feel like a little sausage'. I don't follow your logic. Who throws sausages?— Rory John (@TheRoryJohn) October 24, 2015That sausage analogy was...something #Strictly #SCD— Marianka Swain (@mkmswain) October 24, 2015Is 'I feel like a little sausage' an known saying? #Strictly— Emily Lawson (@Emmy_Lawson) October 24, 2015 Anita's song 'Sweet Disposition' left people bemused:Weird choice of music for Anita's dance #strictly— Nickie (@nickieohara) October 24, 2015This music really, REALLY doesn't work #strictly #scd— Gill Alexander (@gillalexander) October 24, 2015who allowed strictly to use Sweet Disposition as a song to dance to?— Helena (@Helenana_) October 24, 2015Either Sweet Disposition doesn't suit a female voice or this woman is absolutely murdering it. #strictlycomedancing— Ryan Wallace (@Ryn_Bru) October 24, 2015 Gleb drew the usual fawning:Hello Gleb! #strictlycomedancing pic.twitter.com/XIb4ehVMD7— Darren McMask4Mask (@DarrenMcMahon54) October 24, 2015Gleb is s hot #strictlycomedancing— sof ward (@Sofiajward1) October 24, 2015Gleb. That is all. #SCD— Pip Ellwood-Hughes (@Pip_EntFocus) October 24, 2015 Jeremy Vine was very Jeremy Vine-ish:Oh @theJeremyVine You make me smile all the timeI love your joie de vivreTiz far from being a news reader! #scd pic.twitter.com/1Xwl3iFOEm— Paul Dunphy Esquire (@pauldunphy) October 24, 2015Jeremy Vine is what it would be like if Tim Burton was animating a dancing show. #scd— Dave Jones (@WelshGasDoc) October 24, 2015It's the moment we've all been waiting for - @theJeremyVine Dance Pioneer™ takes to the floor. It is a world of endless possibilities. #scd— Jason Evans (@EvansTheCrime) October 24, 2015There's something so very lovely about @theJeremyVine isn't there? #scd— Emma Kennedy (@EmmaKennedy) October 24, 2015Jeremy Vine has having a whale of a time. #scd #strictly. Bruno can sod off.— wafflycat (@wafflycat) October 24, 2015 And there was Bruno's bollocks:Bruno... Amazing. #bullsbollocks #scd pic.twitter.com/10JsCvZoL7— Harry Clayton-Fright (@HClaytonWright) October 24, 2015Its ironic that @TessDaly apologises for @BrunoTonioli's bollocks when we've to put up with her's all night on @BBCStrictly.#SCD #Strictly— ANDY GIBSON TV (@AndyGibsonTV) October 24, 2015It's been ages since I heard someone swear on a live family television show. Well done Bruno Tonioli. #Strictly #SCD— Chris Philpot (@ChrisPhilpot) October 24, 2015"Oh I'm sorry, I didn't realise I said BOLLOCKS BOLLOCKS BOLLOCKS BOLLOCKS" #scd— Steven Perkins (@stevenperkins) October 24, 2015Bruno talking bollocks again.#Strictly #SCD— Lee Thacker (@FubsyShabaroon) October 24, 2015#scd #strictly 'bull's bollocks?' Cue apologies & 7 daily mail outrage articles— Rory John (@TheRoryJohn) October 24, 2015Strictly Come Dancing: The Results airs tomorrow evening on BBC One at 7.15pm
